textos_fuente.text: Meet the Golf Staff - Westmoor CC Member Sign In »Clear Forgot your password? Login Instructions Menu Home About Membership Membership Categories Golf Meet the Golf Staff Guest Information Amenities Dining & Social Pool Meet the Pool Staff Guest Information Tennis Meet the Tennis Staff Guest Policies Careers Contact Directions More ▾ Meet the Golf Staff Guest Information For additional information regarding golf, please contact: Golf Shop (262) 796-7812 golfshop@westmoor.org Golf Staff Vince Pulizzano • Head Golf Professional Vince has been the Head Golf Professional of Westmoor Country Club since 2014. Vince is a sixteen-year member of the PGA of America, and he achieved Certified Professional status in 2018. He brings a wealth of experience to Westmoor, holding previous positions as the Head Golf Professional of Hamilton Farm Golf Club in Gladstone, New Jersey (2010-2013) and as the Assistant Golf Professional at Conway Farms Golf Club in Lake Forest, Illinois (2005-2009). A consummate Golf Professional, Vince brings many skills to Westmoor. Customer service, merchandising, event management, recruiting, and club fitting are just a few of the areas in which he specializes. Vince has been recognized by his peers, winning a total of five PGA of America awards so far in his career. Vince is a graduate of Ferris State University (MI) where he earned a BS degree in Marketing and Professional Golf Management along with a certificate in Business-to-Business Marketing. He is married to his college sweetheart, Marsha, and he has two daughters: Olivia (born in 2011) and Emma (born in 2015). His family resides in Brookfield. Tyler Wood • Assistant Golf Professional Tyler is originally from Eagan, Minnesota. After graduating from Wisconsin Lutheran College in Milwaukee with a business degree, he has returned to WLC to coach the men’s golf team. Tyler has years of experience both playing and working in the golf industry. He played Division III golf and competed in two Division III NCAA National Championships. Tyler previously worked at Mendakota Country Club in Mendota Heights, Minnesota and also Troy Burne Golf Club in Hudson, Wisconsin. Tyler recently married his wife, Lauren, and moved to Waukesha Connor Adlington • Assistant Golf Professional Connor is returning from Scottsdale, Arizona, for his second season at Westmoor Country Club. Originally from Menomonee Falls, he has spent the last decade on the move. Connor served four years as a machine gunner in the United States Marine Corps. After being honorably discharged, he began school at the University of Colorado - Colorado Springs, attending their Professional Golf Management program. Newly graduated, Connor has been at Desert Highlands in Scottsdale, and was recently elected to Class A PGA membership. Molly Braid • Teaching Professional Molly is entering her fifth season as a Teaching Professional at Westmoor Country Club. Molly was recently named the 2022 Wisconsin PGA Teacher of the Year, and for the past four years, she has been named one of the Best Young Teachers in America and Best in State by Golf Digest. She played golf at Pfeiffer University in North Carolina, graduating with a degree in Exercise Science and Sports Medicine. After graduation, she earned her LPGA and PGA Certifications while working as a Teaching Professional and the Director of Junior Golf at the Dana Rader Golf School in Charlotte, North Carolina. Prior to moving to Milwaukee, Molly was the Head Women's Golf Coach at Ithaca College in New York. While coaching at Ithaca, Molly was named the 2016 LPGA T&CP Northeast Coach of the Year and 2017 Empire 8 Conference Coach of the Year. For more information about Molly and her instructional programs, visit www.braidgolf.com . Contact & Directions Privacy Policy - Site by ForeTees 400 South Moorland Road, Brookfield WI 53005 (262) 796-7800 © 2025 Westmoor Country Club

WELCOME to News & Views!  Wynmoor’s official publication.  News & Views is a clearly written, entertaining, and informative guide to the Wynmoor way of life.  Residents are dependent upon this media source to learn about all current events and activities, as well as recreational and educational options available to them just outside their doorstep. News & Views Publication August 2025 News and Views September 2025 News and Views News & Views Advertising All ads are by contract only Term of the contract is 6 months at a cost of $175.00 per month payable in 2-month increments of $350.00 each for a one half-page ad (8-1/2” x 5-1/2”); cost for a full-page ad (8-1/2” x 11”) is $300.00 per month payable in 2-month increments of $600.00 each.  The first payment is due upon contract signing. Ad copy must be directed to News & Views editor at kiaw@wynmoorcc.org no later than the 10 th of the month for the following month; ad may be revised each month if desired.  All changes must be received by the 10 th of the month and payment is due on the 10 th for the following month as well. Further questions may be directed to karens@wynmoorcc.org . News & Views Club Advertising All Club submissions are for Wynmoor Clubs Only. Club submissions are due the 1st of the month for the following month. All club submissions should be sent to kiaw@wynmoorcc.org . Activity Schedule Living in Wynmoor you will always have something to do. Our monthly activity schedule includes both Council and Club events. Please view the ‘Club Update’ Section of the News and Views to see Scheduled Club Activities Back To Previous Page Footer Active Adult Community (954) 978-2600 Driving Directions Address 1310 Avenue of Stars Coconut Creek, FL 33066 Facebook Copyright © 2025 Wynmoor Community Council. Wynmoor Community Council Skip to main content Skip to footer Wynmoor Community Council Adult Community Catering to Your Lifestyle Search this website Facebook THEATRE Show Schedule Movies Schedule Purchasing Tickets Season RECREATION Classes Trips & Dinner Bus Racquet Complex Reservations Clubs Social Activities Special Events Dance & Live Music Country Club Business Center Art & Event Rooms Café on the Green Health Services – MultiMed Wynmoor Pool & Fitness Golf Membership Tournaments Pro Shop Services About Our City Contact Information Cable TV Lineup Links Career Opportunities Media News and Views The Village Choice Community updates Resources Architectural Guidelines Resident Information Wynmoor Community Council Wynmoor Village has a population of over 9,000, residing in 5,260 units, consisting of 44 independent Condominium Associations. Wynmoor “Community Council”, the master association, has a 44-member Board of Directors, (One representative from each association). The Council Board of Directors oversees the maintenance and operation of the Council facilities, including the Theatre, Golf Course, Tennis Courts, Fitness Center, Main and Walking Pools, Country Clubhouse, Transportation Fleet, ect. The 5,260 unit owners in Wynmoor wholly own these amenities. Our fully trained professional staff of over 200, are dedicated to the common goal of promoting excellent “customer” service. Our Council Wynmoor Community Council, Inc. Jackie Railey, President Bruce Bandler, Administrator Selma Bass, Vice President Ronny Sydney, Vice President Vice President: Open Seat David  Mintzes, Vice President Alan Wagner, Secretary Fred Stein, Treasurer 1310 Avenue of the Stars Coconut Creek, Florida 33066 954-978-2600 Monday through Friday, 8 am – 12 pm From time to time, we send news and information to our residents via email. Please CLICK HERE ( RecEnt@wynmoorcc.org ) if you would like to be included. Be sure to type “Wynmoor News Updates” in the Subject Line. Back To Previous Page Footer Active Adult Community (954) 978-2600 Driving Directions Address 1310 Avenue of Stars Coconut Creek, FL 33066 Facebook Copyright © 2025 Wynmoor Community Council. New residents wishing to obtain a barcode should email a copy of your vehicle registration to ResidentRegistration@wynmoorcc.org or call 954-978-2600, and press 2. Once your vehicle is processed Wynmoor security will come to your parking lot and place the barcode on your vehicle. The Association Affairs Office assists condominium directors in operating their associations in accordance with the Florida Condominium Act (Florida Statute 718), as well as their condominium governing documents. If directors are unfamiliar with a situation or have reached a dead end, we assist in resolving it. Additional services include: Handle all requests for approval to sell or lease apartments Education on condominium living to directors and residents Maintain the official records of the condominiums Mediate disputed between associations and residents Property Management Back To Previous Page Footer Active Adult Community (954) 978-2600 Driving Directions Address 1310 Avenue of Stars Coconut Creek, FL 33066 Facebook Copyright © 2025 Wynmoor Community Council. Wynmoor Golf Course, Coconut Creek, FL - Scorecard & Overview Join Now Log In Book a Tee Time Find a Course Learn Equipment Instruction Lifestyle Tour Golf Travel All Articles Resources Find Driving Ranges Find Golf Simulators About Us Find golf lessons Newsletter Join Now Log In Newsletter Search Courses Enter Keyword Home Courses FL Coconut Creek Private N/A No Reviews Yet Wynmoor Golf Course Opened in 1974 Wynmoor - Coconut Creek , Florida Course Details Scorecard Flyover Views Yardage Maps Reviews Nearby Courses Course Details Holes: 18 Par: 60 Length: 3456 yards Slope: 86 Rating: 57.7 Driving Ranges: No The 18-hole "Wynmoor" course at the Wynmoor Golf Course facility in Coconut Creek , Florida features 3456 yards of golf from the longest tees for a par of 60. The course rating is 57.7 and it has a slope rating of 86. The estimated green fees for 18 holes is $41. The Wynmoor golf course opened in  1974. Estimated Green Fees $41 These rates are an estimate of what you might expect to pay at Wynmoor with a cart. Actual rates may vary. Fees are typically lowest Monday through Thursday and during twilight (late afternoon and evenings). Expect to pay the highest rates on weekends. Who We Are | About Us | Lynx Golf UK Clubs Men Women Juniors Gear All Products Bags Accessories Gift Cards Bundles Personalise Sale Golf Guide Our Mission Our Mission Innovation Blog Custom Fitting 10 Clubs Men Women Juniors Gear All Products Bags Accessories Gift Cards Bundles Personalise Sale Golf Guide Our Mission Our Mission Innovation Blog Custom Fitting In the vibrant tapestry of golf history, one brand stands out as a testament to innovation and excellence: Lynx Golf. Born in the 1970s, Lynx emerged as a fierce contender in the world of golf equipment, quickly etching its name into the annals of the sport. From its humble beginnings to the present day, Lynx's journey is a remarkable tale of determination, cutting-edge technology, and triumph. 1970s – A Spark Ignites: Lynx Golf burst onto the scene in the heart of the disco era, embodying the spirit of change and progress. Its founders, John Riley and Carl Ross, were driven by a singular vision: to craft golf equipment that seamlessly fused precision with style. This commitment to excellence set the tone for decades to come. 1980s – A Golden Age: The 1980s saw Lynx soar to prominence as it introduced groundbreaking innovations, pushing the boundaries of golf equipment design. With cutting-edge materials and revolutionary club designs, the brand attracted a wave of enthusiasts and professionals alike. 1990s – Masters of Innovation: The brand's relentless pursuit of perfection birthed game-changing technologies, such as the Parallax irons, which gained a cult following. Amidst fierce competition, Lynx stood out as a beacon of innovation, capturing the hearts of golfers worldwide. Golfing legends such as Fred Couples and Ernie Els wielded Lynx clubs to victory, etching their names in history books. Couples winning the 1992 Masters, and Els the ’94 US Open. 2000s – Global Dominance: As the world entered a new millennium, Lynx continued to redefine golf equipment. The brand's dedication to crafting clubs that married form and function propelled it to the forefront of the golfing world. As the golf landscape evolved, Lynx Golf continued to evolve alongside it. The 2010s saw the brand adapt to modern demands, with an unwavering focus on performance, value and aesthetics. The Lynx Black Cat series, for instance, married sleek design with cutting-edge technology, captivating a new generation of golf enthusiasts. Present Day – Embrace Greatness: The modern advancements of artificial intelligence and bioengineering in sporting equipment has once again propelled Lynx to the front of the pack. The revolutionary Junior Ai clubs which are lauded for their technical application to the growing golfer have once again made Lynx the Brand of Choice for aspiring young golfers, spurred on by the guidance of savvy parents. Lynx continues to bring silverware to professional golfers, with Paul Eales winning the Jamaican Open in 2017, and Dame Laura Davies scooping the big win at the Inaugural Senior US Women’s Open in 2018. Today, Lynx Golf stands as a beacon of inspiration for golfers of all skill levels. With a legacy that spans generations, Lynx remains committed to its core principles of innovation, craftsmanship, and excellence. Unleash Your Potential: As you step onto the green, envision yourself wielding the tools of champions. Embrace the legacy of Lynx Golf and experience the exhilaration of game-changing equipment. Whether you're a seasoned pro or just teeing off for the first time, Lynx clubs are your gateway to unlocking your full potential. Join the ranks of golfing legends and enthusiasts who have embraced Lynx's legacy of  greatness. Elevate your game – choose Lynx Golf and redefine what's possible on the course. In every swing, there's a chance to make history. Choose Lynx Golf and unleash greatness with every shot. Photos info@9holegolfcourses.com Copyright © Morton Technologies, LLC - All rights reserved | Privacy Policy Our disclosure to you: We spend a great deal of time keeping our directory up-to-date.  We are a participant in the Amazon Services LLC Associates Program, an affiliate advertising program designed to provide a means for us to earn fees by linking to Amazon.com and affiliated sites.  We also partner with other advertisers like Rock Bottom Golf and earn commissions by linking to their websites as well.  Please contact us if you have any questions. Par 3 and Executive Golf Courses Privacy Notice × Privacy Notice This privacy notice discloses the privacy practices for Par 3 and Executive Golf Courses. This privacy notice applies solely to information collected by this website. It will notify you of the following: What personally identifiable information is collected from you through the website, how it is used and with whom it may be shared. What choices are available to you regarding the use of your data. The security procedures in place to protect the misuse of your information. How you can correct any inaccuracies in the information. Information Collection, Use, and Sharing We are the sole owners of the information collected on this site. We only have access to/collect information that you voluntarily give us via email or other direct contact from you. We will not sell or rent this information to anyone. We will use your information to respond to you, regarding the reason you contacted us. We will not share your information with any third party outside of our organization, other than as necessary to fulfill your request, e.g. to ship an order. Unless you ask us not to, we may contact you via email in the future to tell you about specials, new products or services, or changes to this privacy policy. Your Access to and Control Over Information You may opt out of any future contacts from us at any time. You can do the following at any time by contacting us via the email address or phone number given on our website: See what data we have about you, if any. Change/correct any data we have about you. Have us delete any data we have about you. Express any concern you have about our use of your data. Security We take precautions to protect your information. When you submit sensitive information via the website, your information is protected both online and offline. Wherever we collect sensitive information (such as credit card data), that information is encrypted and transmitted to us in a secure way. You can verify this by looking for a lock icon in the address bar and looking for "https" at the beginning of the address of the Web page. While we use encryption to protect sensitive information transmitted online, we also protect your information offline. Only employees who need the information to perform a specific job (for example, billing or customer service) are granted access to personally identifiable information. The computers/servers in which we store personally identifiable information are kept in a secure environment. If you feel that we are not abiding by this privacy policy, you should contact us immediately via email. Registration In order to use this website, a user must first complete the registration form. During registration a user is required to give certain information (such as name and email address). This information is used to create a unique user account for you to access our web portal. At your option, you may also provide demographic information (such as gender or age) about yourself, but it is not required. Orders We request information from you on our order form. To buy from us, you must provide contact information (like name and shipping address) and financial information (like credit card number, expiration date). This information is used for billing purposes and to fill your orders. If we have trouble processing an order, we'll use this information to contact you. Cookies We use "cookies" on this site. A cookie is a piece of data stored on a site visitor's hard drive to help us improve your access to our site and identify repeat visitors to our site. For instance, when we use a cookie to identify you, you would not have to log in a password more than once, thereby saving time while on our site. Cookies can also enable us to track and target the interests of our users to enhance the experience on our site. Usage of a cookie is in no way linked to any personally identifiable information on our site. Some of our business partners may use cookies on our site (for example, advertisers). However, we have no access to or control over these cookies. Sharing We share aggregated demographic information with our partners and advertisers. This is not linked to any personal information that can identify any individual person.  We use a credit card processing company to bill users for goods and services. These companies do not retain, share, store or use personally identifiable information for any secondary purposes beyond filling your order. Links This website may contain links to other sites. Please be aware that we are not responsible for the content or privacy practices of such other sites. We encourage our users to be aware when they leave our site and to read the privacy statements of any other site that collects personally identifiable information. Surveys & Contests From time-to-time our site requests information via surveys or contests. Participation in these surveys or contests is completely voluntary and you may choose whether or not to participate and therefore disclose this information. Information requested may include contact information (such as name and shipping address), and demographic information (such as zip code, age level). Contact information will be used to notify the winners and award prizes. Survey information will be used for purposes of monitoring or improving the use and satisfaction of this site. Close We'd like permission to email you ONCE a month! We promise, just once a month.  We will email you news about our site, deals and offers from Golf retailers, and other Golf info you might find interesting! You can opt-out at any time, but we hope you don't. Just enter your email below.  We will send you a validation link to confirm you really do want email from us (we respect your privacy). Email Address Also enter me for FREE Monthly Golf Ball Drawing at WinFreeGolfBalls.com * Click here to submit form and join our list! * We also own WinFreeGolfBalls.com - we will NEVER sell or otherwise transfer your email address to anyone. Yardage + Green Map \/ Yards","public_title":"Yardage + Green Map \/ Yards","options":["Yardage + Green Map","Yards"],"price":4900,"weight":56,"compare_at_price":null,"inventory_management":null,"barcode":null,"featured_media":{"alt":null,"id":34074705068326,"position":4,"preview_image":{"aspect_ratio":1.0,"height":1080,"width":1080,"src":"\/\/puttviewbooks.com\/cdn\/shop\/products\/yardagegreenmap_6c8fc712-c8d1-4340-bc70-98545a9466e7.jpg?v=1686335728"}},"requires_selling_plan":false,"selling_plan_allocations":[]} Product Description Book size measurement is 6.5"x 3.75" and greens are scaled to no larger than 3/8 inch to 5 yards (USGA conforming). Distance is presented in yards and slope is presented in percentage. They are saddle stitched to fit perfectly inside a traditional yardage book cover. Variant types: Yardage Penalty to penalty width distance Carries and runout distances Compass off tee shot and into green Tee to fairway and fairway to green +/- elevation change To green and from tee distance rings Major Slopes Everything in the yardage book, plus: Detailed thermal green view with contours and arrows in major slope areas (3% and above). Also includes arrows and contours in surrounding areas around green. Fairway arrows that represent slope above 4% Yardage + Green Map Everything in the yardage book, plus: Duel view topographical green map Thermal View - easily see ridges and spot possible hole locations Detailed View - supports green reading with arrows and contours shown at the maximum resolution allowed within the rules of golf Fairway arrows that represent slope above 4% 0 Shipping & Returns Shipping As our books are made to order, shipping times may vary. We appreciate your patience and understanding. Returns ReturnsWe only accept returns for books confirmed by the carrier to be damaged during transit. Please inspect your order upon delivery and contact us within 14 days of the posted delivery date if the item is defective, damaged, or incorrect.
